metadata.title: CVE-2024-56730 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/9p/usbg: fix handling of the failed kzalloc() memory allocationOn the linux-next, next-20241108 vanilla kernel, the coccinelle tool gavethefollowing error report:./net/9p/trans_usbg.c:912:5-11: ERROR: allocation function on line 911returnsNULL not ERR_PTR on failurekzalloc() failure is fixed to handle the NULL return case on the memoryexhaustion.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
